title: Jasmine Tookes Is Making the Most Controversial Summer Trend Less Risqué by Styling It Like This
description: Tookes shares the five trends she's most excited to wear this summer.
excerpt: Supermodel Jasmine Tookes is reimagining summer trends her way, inspired by European escapes and minimalist style. See her top five picks.
text: Of all the trends dominating the fashion scene right now, sheer just might be the most polarizing. But if anyone can make the barely there look feel elegant, it’s Jasmine Tookes. The supermodel and entrepreneur just debuted her first swimwear collaboration with Miami-based brand Montce, and it’s filled with elevated takes on vacation staples—including sheer swim pieces that she strategically uses for fun layered looks. Inspired by her jet-setting lifestyle and the refined aesthetic she’s known for, the collection basically makes up her capsule wardrobe for summer vacations.We caught up with Tookes to celebrate the launch, chat through what her dream summer wardrobe looks like, and get inspired to build a capsule of our own. From styling tips to retro nostalgia, she inspired me to reimagine my packing list. Below, find the five trends she’s shopping for summer 2025.1. Sheer Layers and Skirts “Sheer is such a fun way to add texture and movement to your summer wardrobe. I love a mesh maxi dress or a sheer button-down thrown over a bralette and shorts. It feels sexy without trying too hard and is perfect for beach days or summer nights out.” — Tookes Montce Cherry Micro Skirt Andrea Iyamah Naru One Piece Swimsuit 2. Sculptural Swimwear “Even when I’m not swimming, I want my swimwear to feel intentional and fashion-forward. This season, I’m loving pieces with structured necklines, cutouts, and modern silhouettes. A strong one-piece or sculpted bikini top can double as a bodysuit for post-beach plans.” — Tookes Montce Sable Zoe One-Piece MANGO Asymmetrical Swimsuit With Hoop Away That Day Cannes One Piece Swimsuit 3. Minimalist White Dresses “A crisp white dress is a warm-weather essential. It's timeless, clean, and always looks fresh. I love everything from easy cotton minis to dramatic, flowy maxis. Add a slicked-back bun and gold hoops, and it’s a whole moment.” — Tookes Reiss Elise Linen A-Line Dress Reformation Kayla Knit Dress Montce Seychelles Petal Long Slip Dress 4. High-Cut Bottoms “A high-cut swim bottom is my forever favorite. It instantly elongates the legs and gives that supermodel silhouette.” — Tookes Montce Cherry Cream Binded Polly Bikini Bottom free people Toast Signature Cinch Bikini Bottoms ViX Paula Hermanny Firenze Paige Bikini Bottoms 5. Crochet Everything “Crochet is having a major moment again, and I’m here for it. I love a good crochet set or dress for vacation—it adds that touch of handmade charm and texture while still feeling elevated. It’s also perfect to layer over swimwear or pair with flat sandals for a relaxed look.” — Tookes LoveShackFancy Alaya Cutout Crop Cardigan 6. Linen Sets “You can never go wrong with a flowy linen set. Whether worn together or styled as separates, it instantly gives that effortless summer feel—light, breathable, and incredibly comfortable.” — Tookes free people Sunny Somewhere Cotton-Linen Set DEIJI STUDIOS The 03 Washed-Linen Shirt and Shorts Set Reformation Grace Linen Two Piece 7. Barely There Sandals “For shoes, I’m leaning into clean, minimal sandals with delicate straps and neutral tones. They go with everything and keep your look grounded, whether you're wearing a floaty dress or denim shorts. Comfort is key, but I never want to sacrifice style.” — Tookes Vagabond Shoemakers Izzy Strappy Sandal A.Emery Edna Snake-Effect Leather Sandals AEYDE Nala Leather Sandals Sierra Mayhew is a fashion editor at Who What Wear, bringing a decade of industry experience to the editorial team. Since joining in 2021, she has made her mark by blending luxury and accessible fashion, decoding runway trends, and curating must-have shopping lists. Before joining Who What Wear, Sierra sharpened her skills at Harper's Bazaar and Elle, with bylines in Bazaar.com and collaborated with iconic brands such as Gucci and Ferragamo. A graduate of the University of Notre Dame, Sierra translates editorial expertise into viral social content, making fashion engaging for a new generation. Her unique perspective is rooted in her love for travel, music, and discovering the hidden gems that make New York City a constant source of inspiration.
html:
Of all the trends dominating the fashion scene right now, sheer just might be the most polarizing. But if anyone can make the barely there look feel elegant, it’s Jasmine Tookes. The supermodel and entrepreneur just debuted her first swimwear collaboration with Miami-based brand Montce, and it’s filled with elevated takes on vacation staples—including sheer swim pieces that she strategically uses for fun layered looks. Inspired by her jet-setting lifestyle and the refined aesthetic she’s known for, the collection basically makes up her capsule wardrobe for summer vacations.

We caught up with Tookes to celebrate the launch, chat through what her dream summer wardrobe looks like, and get inspired to build a capsule of our own. From styling tips to retro nostalgia, she inspired me to reimagine my packing list. Below, find the five trends she’s shopping for summer 2025.

1. Sheer Layers and Skirts

“Sheer is such a fun way to add texture and movement to your summer wardrobe. I love a mesh maxi dress or a sheer button-down thrown over a bralette and shorts. It feels sexy without trying too hard and is perfect for beach days or summer nights out.” — Tookes

Montce

Cherry Micro Skirt

Andrea Iyamah

Naru One Piece Swimsuit

2. Sculptural Swimwear

“Even when I’m not swimming, I want my swimwear to feel intentional and fashion-forward. This season, I’m loving pieces with structured necklines, cutouts, and modern silhouettes. A strong one-piece or sculpted bikini top can double as a bodysuit for post-beach plans.” — Tookes

Montce

Sable Zoe One-Piece

MANGO

Asymmetrical Swimsuit With Hoop

Away That Day

Cannes One Piece Swimsuit

3. Minimalist White Dresses

“A crisp white dress is a warm-weather essential. It's timeless, clean, and always looks fresh. I love everything from easy cotton minis to dramatic, flowy maxis. Add a slicked-back bun and gold hoops, and it’s a whole moment.” — Tookes

Reiss

Elise Linen A-Line Dress

Reformation

Kayla Knit Dress

Montce

Seychelles Petal Long Slip Dress

4. High-Cut Bottoms

“A high-cut swim bottom is my forever favorite. It instantly elongates the legs and gives that supermodel silhouette.” — Tookes

Montce

Cherry Cream Binded Polly Bikini Bottom

free people

Toast Signature Cinch Bikini Bottoms

ViX Paula Hermanny

Firenze Paige Bikini Bottoms

5. Crochet Everything

“Crochet is having a major moment again, and I’m here for it. I love a good crochet set or dress for vacation—it adds that touch of handmade charm and texture while still feeling elevated. It’s also perfect to layer over swimwear or pair with flat sandals for a relaxed look.” — Tookes

LoveShackFancy

Alaya Cutout Crop Cardigan

6. Linen Sets

“You can never go wrong with a flowy linen set. Whether worn together or styled as separates, it instantly gives that effortless summer feel—light, breathable, and incredibly comfortable.” — Tookes

free people

Sunny Somewhere Cotton-Linen Set

DEIJI STUDIOS

The 03 Washed-Linen Shirt and Shorts Set

Reformation

Grace Linen Two Piece

7. Barely There Sandals

“For shoes, I’m leaning into clean, minimal sandals with delicate straps and neutral tones. They go with everything and keep your look grounded, whether you're wearing a floaty dress or denim shorts. Comfort is key, but I never want to sacrifice style.” — Tookes

Vagabond Shoemakers

Izzy Strappy Sandal

A.Emery

Edna Snake-Effect Leather Sandals

AEYDE

Nala Leather Sandals

Sierra Mayhew is a fashion editor at Who What Wear, bringing a decade of industry experience to the editorial team. Since joining in 2021, she has made her mark by blending luxury and accessible fashion, decoding runway trends, and curating must-have shopping lists. Before joining Who What Wear, Sierra sharpened her skills at Harper's Bazaar and Elle, with bylines in Bazaar.com and collaborated with iconic brands such as Gucci and Ferragamo. A graduate of the University of Notre Dame, Sierra translates editorial expertise into viral social content, making fashion engaging for a new generation. Her unique perspective is rooted in her love for travel, music, and discovering the hidden gems that make New York City a constant source of inspiration.
